required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Health Effects of Oat and Oat Bioactive in Human
clinical_study.official_title: Dose Response Effects of Oat Bioactive in Healthy Adults

brief_summary.textblock: Aim of the study is to investigate health effects of oats and oat derived components, in human intervention studies, with the purpose to build new knowledge for development of cardiometabolic protective foods

detailed_description.textblock: The overall goal is to increase the knowledge which can be used for the development of food products with anti-diabetic properties, with the purpose to facilitate healthier food choices for people. More specifically the primary purpose of this project is to evaluate effects in healthy humans on cardiometabolic test markers of oat and oat based product. The new knowledge will form a base for the development of oat based food products with added health values.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 0 - 5.5 hours ( at fasting and then repeatedly after breakfast and Standardize lunch)
primary_outcome.description: Postprandial blood glucose regulation (incremental area under the curve) acute after intake of the test products and at forthcoming meals within 5.5 hours after consumption of test products.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 - 5.5 hours ( at fasting and then repeatedly after breakfast and Standardize lunch)
secondary_outcome.description: Acute effects of postprandial serum insulin concentrations (incremental area under the curve) after intake of the test products.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 - 5.5 hours ( at fasting and then repeatedly after breakfast and Standardize lunch)
secondary_outcome.description: Gastro-intestinale hormones involved in appetite and metabolic regulation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 - 5.5 hours ( at fasting and then repeatedly after breakfast and Standardize lunch)
secondary_outcome.description: Gastro-intestinale hormones involved in appetite and metabolic regulation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 - 5.5 hours ( at fasting and then repeatedly after breakfast and Standardize lunch)
0 - 5.5 hours ( at fasting and then repeatedly after breakfast and Standardize lunch)
0 - 5.5 hours ( at fasting and then repeatedly after breakfast and Standardize lunch)

other_outcome.time_frame: 0 - 5.5 hours ( at fasting and then repeatedly after breakfast and Standardize lunch)
other_outcome.description: Determined with VAS (visual analogue scale) scales (0-100 mm) as a range of subjective sensations related to appetite (such as hunger, desire to eat or fullness)

other_outcome.time_frame: 0 - 5.5 hours ( at fasting and then repeatedly after breakfast and Standardize lunch)
other_outcome.description: Determined with VAS (visual analogue scale) scales 0-100 mm

arm_group.description: The test portion is based on 50 gram available carbohydrates with added vegetable oil A. Test portion consumed as a breakfast meal prior to determinations of test variables in the morning.
The test portion is based on 50 gram available carbohydrates with added vegetable oil B. Test portion consumed as a breakfast meal prior to determinations of test variables in the morning.

The test portion is based on 50 gram available carbohydrates with added vegetable oil A + vegetable oil B. Test portion consumed as a breakfast meal prior to determinations of test variables in the morning.
The test portion is based on 50 gram available carbohydrates without added vegetable oil. Test portion consumed as a breakfast meal prior to determinations of test variables in the morning.

intervention.intervention_name: Effects of Oat and Oat Components on Cardiometabolic risk variables
intervention.description: Oat and oat bioactive components consumed as breakfast meal.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy adults
- BMI 18,5 - 28
- non smokers
- consuming a non-vegetarian diet that follows the Nordic guidances
Exclusion Criteria:
- Fasting blood glucose concentration >6.1 mmol/l
- Known cardio-metabolic disease (e.g. diabetes, hypertension, metabolic syndrome), gastro-intestinal disorders such as IBS (irritable bowel syndrome) that can interfere with the study results, food allergies. Further no antibiotics or probiotics should have been consumed within 4 weeks prior to and during the study

facility.name: Food Technology, engineering and Nutrition, LTH, Lund University
